result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Todd Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge and supervison fees as determined by DOC.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Any cash bail to apply.
To be applied during term of probation.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdmeanor crime of domestic vilence.
No contact with the victim unless requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the Court.

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: No reply from the defendant or surety. er
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.

Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) gj

**Re-sent Notice to surety, new address on 10-10-2017** gj

Defendant Michael Todd Ford in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Michael Todd Ford in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 18 days time served. The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

As to Count 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1 and any other sentence.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.  To be paid during term of probation.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Todd Ford in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Count 1 & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Violation Report (positive drug test- opiates) received and filed.

Defendant Michael Todd Ford in court.  Attorney Richard Thomey appears by phone.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Jennifer Hoffmann.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Final Pre-Trial on January 21, 2016  at 8:15 am in Branch 38.

All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Todd Ford in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court will require records from defendant, if hospitalized, for missed court dates in the future.  Parties to discuss a potential deferred prosecution agreement.  Case is currently scheduled for a Jury Trial on 8-10-2015 at 8:15 am, Branch 38.   Court to be advised by 7-15-2015, if a resolution is reached by the parties.  Court ordered defendant back on Justice Point Supervision.  Court also warned defendant, that if any further violations are received, he would go into custody and that bail would be increased.  EFFECTIVE AUGUST 3, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE HON. JEFFREY WAGNER, BRANCH 38, IN ROOM 504 OF THE COURTHOUSE.   mld

Defendant was admitted on 4-2-2015, will be restricted to the grounds until 4-16-2015 and will not complete the treatment until 5-16-2015.  Case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 4 on 6-2-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 8-10-2015 at 8:30 am.  The Bench Warrant is continued stayed by the Court until the next date of 6-2-2015.   mld

Letter was submitted to the court from defense counsel, that the defendant is currently an inpatient at the VA Hospital, and subsequently will be transferred to an inpatient residential treatment program for a 6 week duration.  Per the Court: defense counsel will need to get clarification from the VA, regarding when defendant entered program, release conditions if any, (for court) and the length of the duration.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for calendar call in Branch 4 on 4-14-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
